greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of permutations p of [n] such that the up-down signature of p has nonnegative partial sums with a maximal value of k; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..100, flattened
maple: b:= proc(u, o, c) option remember; `if`(c<0, 0, `if`(u+o=0, x^c,
T:= n-> `if`(n=0, 1, (p-> seq(coeff(p, x, i), i=0..n)
mathematica: b[u_, o_, c_] := b[u, o, c] = If[c<0, 0, If[u+o==0, x^c, Sum[Coefficient[ #, x, i]*x^Max[i, c], {i, 0, Exponent[#, x]}]]& @ Sum[b[u-j, o-1+j, c-1], {j, 1, u}] + Sum[b[u+j-1, o-j, c+1], {j, 1, o}]];
T[n_] := If[n==0, {1}, Table[Coefficient[#, x, i], {i, 0, n}]]& @ Sum[b[j-1, n-j, 0], {j, 1, n}];
T /@ Range[0, 10] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 19 2020, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Sep 11 2015
